Detailed Description

The barshader class is responsible for drawing the chunk-based progress bars used in aMule.

CBarShader represents the chunks of a file through the use of spans, which cover a range in the file with a certain color. New spans can be added on the fly and old spans are automatically removed, resized or merged when necessary.

CBarShader will try to minimize the number of spans when possible.

int  iLeft,
int  iTop,
bool  bFlat 
)

Draws the bar on the specifed wxDC.

Parameters:
dc The wxDC upon which the bar should be drawn.
iLeft The left position from where to start drawing.
iTop The top position from where to start drawing.
bFlat 3D effect is not applied if this is true.

This functions draws the bar with the height and width specified through either the contructor or with SetWidth() and SetHeight().

void CBarShader::FillRange ( uint64  start,
uint64  end,
const CMuleColour &  colour 
)

Fills in a range with a certain color.

Parameters:
start The starting position of the new span.
end The ending position of the new span. Must be larger than start.
colour The colour of the new span.

Calling this function fill the specified range with the specified color. Any spans completly or partially covered by the new span are either removed or resized. If the value of end is larger than the current filesize, the filesize is increased to the value of end.

References m_FileSize, and m_Width.

void CBarShader::SetFileSize ( uint64  fileSize  )  [inline]

Sets a new filesize.

Parameters:
fileSize The new filesize.

Calling this function sets a new filesize, which is the virtual length of the bar. This function must be called before any filling.

void CBarShader::SetWidth ( int  width  ) 

Sets the width of the drawn bar.

Parameters:
width The new width.

Setting this sets the width the bar which is used when it is drawn and resets the pixel buffer to the fill color.
